Forcepoint Email-Security: SPF failure error detected.
rule.info: Description : This alert is triggered when an incoming email fails the Sender Policy Framework (SPF) check, indicating the sender's domain did not authorize the sending mail server. This could be due to misconfigured SPF records or potential email spoofing.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: SPF temperror error detected.
rule.info: Description: This alert is triggered when the SPF (Sender Policy Framework) verification fails due to a temporary DNS error, preventing the SPF record from being retrieved or validated.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: SPF natural error detected.
rule.info: Description: This alert is triggered when an email fails the SPF (Sender Policy Framework) validation, indicating that the sending server is not authorized to send emails on behalf of the domain, which could signify spoofing or misconfiguration.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Global IP address block list updated by Security or Quarantine administrator.
rule.info: Description :This rule triggers an alert when a Security Administrator or Quarantine Administrator updates the Global IP Address Block List. Changes to this list can significantly affect the networkï¿½s security posture by blocking or unblocking specific IP addresses, possibly preventing malicious traffic or altering security controls.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Global Email address block list updated by Security or Quarantine administrator.
rule.info: Description :This rule triggers when a Security Administrator or Quarantine Administrator updates the Global Email Address Block List. Modifying this list can either allow or block specific email addresses, affecting email communication, spam filtering, and phishing prevention measures.

rule.field: ^(Operation: set service --name SSL-proxy --action stop Result: Success)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: SSL-Proxy service stopped by CLI administrator.
rule.info: Description : Stopping or disabling security-related services, like SSL-proxy, can be part of an attempt to weaken the system's defenses and allow malicious traffic through encrypted channels.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Configuration saved by CLI user with non-admin privileges
rule.info: Description : This rule tracks when a CLI Administrator saves configuration changes in the Forcepoint Security Manager. Saving configurations can affect system policies, security settings, and operational behavior. This action requires monitoring to ensure that configuration changes are authorized and do not degrade the system's security posture.

Saving configurations can affect system policies, security settings, and operational behavior. This action requires monitoring to ensure that configuration changes are authorized and do not degrade the system's security posture.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Drop and quarantine events detected.
rule.info: Description: This alert is triggered when emails are dropped or quarantined due to security policies, such as detecting malicious content, unauthorized attachments, or policy violations.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email dropped and quarantined due to spam or virus.
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when an email is accepted but subsequently quarantined due to being identified as spam or containing a virus. This process ensures that emails flagged for further analysis are not delivered to recipients while protecting the organization from potential risks.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Multiple emails dropped and quarantined due to spam or virus from same source IP.
rule.info: Description:This rule triggers an alert when five emails are dropped and quarantined due to being flagged as spam or containing a virus from the same source IP but involving different users within a minute. This behavior can be indicative of a mass email attack, such as a phishing campaign, or a misconfigured email server attempting to send spam/malicious emails.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email dropped but quarantined due to suspecious domains.
rule.info: Description: This alert was triggered because an email contained one or more suspicious domains flagged for potential phishing, malware, or other malicious activity. To prevent harm, the email was dropped and quarantined for further review.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Multiple emails dropped and quarantined due to suspecious domains from same source IP.
rule.info: Description: This rule triggers when five emails are accepted and quarantined due to being flagged as spam or containing a virus from the same source IP but involving different users within a minute. This can indicate a coordinated attack, where multiple emails containing potentially harmful content are being sent rapidly from the same source, but they are intercepted by quarantine mechanisms.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email dropped and quarantined due to phishing attachement.
rule.info: Description: This alert was triggered because an email contained a phishing attachment designed to steal sensitive information or deliver malware. To mitigate the threat, the email was dropped and quarantined.

rule.action: ^(Failed for delivery not authorized, message refused)$|(^Delayed for delivery not authorized, message refused)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delayed or failed due to unauthorized delivery, message refused.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects instances where emails are delayed or failed due to delivery not being authorized, and the message is refused by the recipient's mail server. This typically occurs when the sender is not permitted to deliver emails to the recipient domain due to policy restrictions, potential blacklisting, or sender authentication failures (e.g., SPF/DKIM issues). It can be indicative of attempted spoofing, phishing, or malicious email activity blocked by security policies.

rule.action: ^(Failed for bad destination mailbox address)$|^(Delayed for bad destination mailbox address)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Invalid email destination detected.
rule.info: Description: This rule monitors instances where email delivery fails or is delayed due to an invalid or non-existent destination mailbox address. This may be due to a typo in the email address or could indicate a Directory Harvesting Attack (DHA), where attackers attempt to discover valid email addresses by sending messages to many invalid recipients. It's essential to track these events to detect potential malicious enumeration of mailboxes or poorly configured email routing.

rule.action: ^(Failed for message too big for system)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery failed due to an oversized message exceeding system limits.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when email delivery fails due to the message size exceeding the maximum allowed by the recipient's system. Such failures might occur due to large attachments, multimedia content, or improperly configured email servers. Though not directly malicious, repeated occurrences could indicate attempts to bypass email security filters or overwhelm the mail system with large volumes of data.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery delayed due to bad sender system address.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when email deliveries are delayed due to issues with the sender's system address. Such delays can arise from misconfigured email servers, compromised systems sending spam, or network issues affecting the sender's ability to relay emails.

rule.action: ^(Delayed for other error)$|^(Failed for other error)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery delayed or failed due to other errors.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects emails delayed or failed due to unspecified errors. These errors might indicate underlying misconfigurations, server issues, or attempts to bypass normal email security protocols.

rule.action: ^(Delayed for unable to route)$|^(Failed for unable to route)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery delayed or failed due to routing issues.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects emails delayed or failed due to routing problems. Such issues may stem from misconfigured servers, network outages, or attempts to deliver emails to invalid destinations, possibly signaling malicious activity.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery failed due to unknown errors.
rule.info: Description: This rule identifies emails that failed due to unknown delivery errors. Such failures might indicate server misconfigurations, unsupported recipients, or potential malicious activities attempting to disrupt communication.

rule.action: ^(Failed for bad sender mailbox address syntax)$
rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery failed due to bad sender mailbox address syntax.
rule.info: Description: This rule identifies emails that failed due to incorrect sender mailbox address syntax. Such errors may stem from misconfigured email clients or servers, malicious activities, or user mistakes in email addressing.

rule.description: Forcepoint Email-Security: Email delivery failed due to a detected routing loop.
rule.info: Description: This rule identifies emails that failed due to a routing loop, which may indicate email server misconfiguration or malicious redirection attempts causing emails to be indefinitely rerouted.
